item.title: Cracked pavement slabs, 14th November
item.description:
The road have a lot of uneven cracked paving slabs which need to be replaced please. As we do trip at times which is dangerous. Much appreciated

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mineral Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping is constant on and around the areas, 14th November
item.description:
Old mattress, furniture, pram, rubbish. Practically every day. It need to stop they come at night with big vans and dump their rubbish. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mineral Street, Plumstead

item.title: Poor road surface, 14th November
item.description:
A large stretch of this road is now so badly damaged it’s becoming dangerous. Money and time has been spent filling small islands with tarmac but the road directly next to it is now mirroring an unmade road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deptford Church Street, Deptford, London

item.title: Puddle of water where old paving meets new. Rain not draing away., 14th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Adley Street, Hackney, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Bus hit a lamppost, 14th November
item.description:
Reporting bus has collided into lamppost & now at an angle. No exposed wires. Lamppost number: H7042. Opposite British Heart Foundation, High Street, Bromley, BR1 1NN. Fire brigade onsite now moving the bus. Police cad: 31 (14/11/25)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 200,202, High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hampstead road, 14th November
item.description:
Hampstead Road (A400) regularly suffers long delays and queues, particularly around the Robert Street junction. Temporary signals/works are causing vehicles to block side roads and pedestrian crossings, creating dangerous conditions for pedestrians and cyclists and delaying emergency vehicles. Please investigate signal timing, consider traffic-calming or stewarding, or just get a move on with the work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Road, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, Victoria Way, 14th November
item.description:
Charlton Triangle Homes stopped locking its bin stores long ago, so its residents use this area as a spot to dump furniture. Shouldn’t the council take action against Charlton Triangle/Peabody?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Way, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown shrub on Tunnel Road blocking parking space, 14th November
item.description:
There is a vine tree/plant growing on Tunnel Road on the side of the Sands Film Studio building which has overgrown and now obstructing a parking space. The branches are long and scratching the side and roof of cars trying to park in the space. The branches have grown considerably in the past 4 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121-145, Hatteraick Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
